message: Look for gromacs include directory in a more flexible way
Fix bug in gromacs top file parser where #else preprocessor directives were not being followed
Add a reader and createSystem interface for Desmond dms files
reorder the exclusion before the pair_12_6_es_term so simplify code
Ignore constraints that connect two massless particles (feature request 1915)
Implement virtualsites and better checking of unsupported params/tables
Added unittest and 1 system tests. Includes 1 bugfix to resolving a circular import and 1 bugfix where dms wasn't creating the topology correctly when the water was specified in different chains
Bugfix: dms.positions should be a Quantity(list(Vec3))  not a list(Quantity(Vec3))
same fix about list(quantity) vs quantity(list) for unitcell dimensions
Python records where OpenMM is installed  so it doesn't need to be specified with environment variables at runtime
Added option to omit PILE thermostat from RPMD
Lots of code cleanup related to constraints in the reference platform
Made identification of plugin directory slightly more robust
Early beginnings of creating an optimized CPU platform
More optimizations to neighborlist construction  including SSE intrinsics
Separated hardware query functions into a separate file.  CPU platform checks for the correct hardware.
Began creating optimized implementation of direct space nonbonded calculation
Continuing to optimize CPU nonbonded routines
PME works correctly in CPU platform
Use optimized PME implementation when available
Do not rebuild the neighbor list every time step
Corrected minor bug in GBneck screening parameter assignment. The existing logic was:
Add a comment to clarify that calling setReactionFieldDielectric on force instead of gb is intentional.
Bug fix  plus a minor optimization to reference platform
Write CONECT records to PDB files
Prevent segfaults when a simulation blows up

Take the 1-4 non-bonded scaling parameters from the Amber topology files if present  defaulting to 1.2 (SCEE) and 2.0 (SCNB) if they're not present. If values for scee and scnb are provided to readAmberSystem they will override any values in the topology file  but a warning will be printed (since ignoring the scaling parameters in the topology file really changes the force field).
Lots of optimizations to Lepton  including creating CompiledExpression class.
Converted lots of ExpressionPrograms to CompiledExpressions

Support gzip and bzip2 compression for StateDataReporter (based on filename extension). Users were already able to pass gzip.GzipFile objects and StateDataReporter would write compressed data. bz2.BZ2File objects also worked after I removed the self._out.flush() calls.
Add the flush calls back to statedatareporter properly protected by try-except.

Implement GBn2 (equivalent to igb==8 in Amber) via CustomGBForce. [1] The energy computed with OpenMM matches that computed with Amber for the new model as well as the existing models do (see table below). GBn2 is a much better GB model than either the OBC models or the original GB neck by all indications...
Tweak comment in createSystem docstring to indicate GBn2 as an available choice.
Created vector classes to simplify SSE code
Restructured nonbonded calculation to allow more efficient vectorization
Optimized algorithm for building neighbor list.
Parallelized the processing of exclusions for Ewald
Fixed an error in generating Python wrappers
Enabled the SSE version of SFMT
Minor optimizations to neighbor list construction
Do a more complex test to decide when to rebuild the neighbor list
Minor change to the neighbor list padding distance
Fixed errors in Python wrapping of AmoebaMultipoleForce
Created ThreadPool to simplify parallel code
Added a missing dependency on pthreads
Further optimizations to CPU nonbonded force
Minor optimizations to CPU platform: avoid applying periodic boundary conditions unnecessarily
Also use the previous optimization with reaction field
Skip all /internal directories when building Python wrappers.  This allows the configuration file to be simplified.
Centralized the forces  positions  and thread pool so they can be shared between kernels
Created optimized CPU version of GBSAOBCForce
Minor optimizations to CPU version of GBSAOBCForce
Moved benchmarking script into main repository
Optimizations to CPU version of GBSA
Improved the geometry of hydroxyls when adding hydrogens
Tabulated log(x) to improve GB performance
Fixed compilation errors on OS X 10.9
Began rewriting C/Fortran wrapper generation to use Doxygen/Python instead of gccxml/XSLT
Fixed errors on OS X 10.9: link against libc++ instead of libstdc++
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/peastman/openmm into wrappers
Fixed bugs in computing PME energy with CPU platform
Bug fixes to wrapper generation.  Implemented wrappers for AMOEBA.
Removed files related to the old wrapper generators
Include serialization classes directly in main library
Optimization to building neighbor list on CPU platform
Optimizations to CPU nonbonded forces: better load balancing between threads  use linear splines instead of cubic
Enforce memory alignment to improve performance of vector operations.  Also fixed bugs in an earlier optimization.
More fixes for problems on OS X 10.9
Added implementation for equality __eq__() and inequality __ne__() operators
Check type in __eq__() and __ne__()  simplify code
Major simplification to constraint handling in reference platform
Test case for SETTLE on CPU platform
Still more fixes for problems on OS X 10.9
Pickling an Element object works correctly
RPMD works correctly with a barostat
Fixes for compilation errors on Visual Studio 2013
Plugins work with CPU platform.  This involved separating the reference implementations of plugins into their own libraries.
Fixed errors when using pre-1.8 versions of Doxygen
All code is compiled with SSE enabled.  This eliminates errors with some compilers.
Reference implementation of AndersenThermostat did not handle massless particles correctly
Fixed compilation errors in debug mode
Merged latest changes from main branch
Detect if user specifies an unknown property name
Fixed some incorrect parameters in SWM4-NDP water model
Added option for setting CUDA host compiler
Created wrapper classes for AVX vectors
Created AVX implementation of CPU nonbonded force
Add a salt concentration term to the custom GB forces and add an optional "kappa" keyword to the Amber createSystem method call to allow users to specify it.
Automatically select whether to use the SSE or AVX version of CpuNonbondedForce
Fixed bug in detecting if AVX is supported
Fixed a compilation error on gcc 4.4
Benchmark script did not set OpenCLPrecision correctly
Parallelized summing the forces from different threads
Fixed quotes in command line when using CudaHostCompiler option
Allow implicitSolventKappa to have units (it has dimensions of length) and convert the number to pure nanometers before using it in the GB code.
Bring GBn2 into the simtk.openmm.app namespace. Also remove some redundant references.
Apparently 1/u.nanometers is a quantity rather than a unit  so the command:
Correct treatment of kappa when kappa == 0 and when there is a cutoff.
Fix misplacement of "kappa" in cutoff-GB expression.
Added missing required kernel names (ApplyConstraintsKernel and VirtualSitesKernel) to check for platform capabilities  since these kernels are initialized in the next code block.
Workaround for compilation error on some compilers
Fixed some bugs identified by Valgrind
Improved logic for selecting a platform to better deal with exceptions in context initialization
Merged changes between repositories by hand
Ensure SFMT data array is correctly aligned
Fixed lots of compilation errors on Windows
StateDataReport can report % progress  speed  and time to completion
Fixed a bug that could potentially cause LJ energy to be nan
Fixed a bug in OpenCL implementation of CustomGBForce
Same bug fix as the previous commit  but for CUDA
Detect Visual Studio in a way that works correctly with NMake files
Detect Visual Studio in a way that works correctly with NMake files
Added methods for changing default parameters on barostats and thermostats
Fixed a compilation error when building wrappers
Test cases detect if CPU is not supported and exit rather than crashing

Change implicitSolentKappa to implicitSolventSaltConc and convert to implicitSolventKappa the same (black-magic) way that Amber does. I have never been able to reproduce the prefactor used to convert to kappa in Amber... sigh.
Workaround for bug in Visual Studio
Fixed a test case that occasionally failed
Ensure that PYTHON_EXECUTABLE is visible to all CMake scripts
Fixed an error in CMake script when compiling with clang
Added a .travis.yml file to allow Travis CI to perform build tests
fixed some parts of travis yml
Temporarily commented out tests during debugging added ls /OpenMM/include to see what is happening with that
changed to home directory for OpenMM root
set destination directory with cmake instead of make
Fixed errors in wrapper generation when using Visual Studio 2010
Parallelized the computation of torsions with CPU platform
Parallelized the initialization of positions and forces in the CPU platform
Prevent trying to use the CPU OpenCL device on OS X
Fixed a crash caused by a change to initialization order
CPU  CUDA  and OpenCL platforms can now be built statically
PME Plugin can now be built statically
Also catch ValueError in _is_string. Fix indentation to be consistent (5 spaces to 4 -- this would be a SyntaxError in Python3).
Fix linker issues for CPU platform on Windows

Update implicit solvent salt concentration/kappa handling. Now  if implicitSolventKappa is provided it will be used. Otherwise  implicitSolventSaltConc will be used to compute kappa from the solvent dielectric constant and simulation temperature.
Reference Amoeba and Drude static libraries can be built
Use static pthread_mt libraries when doing static builds on windows
Convert temperature from a quantity to float if it's a quantity.
changed to nosetests and commented out manual python tests

In the generated C wrappers  instantiate std::string arguments from 'const char*' by passing it straight to the std::string constructor rather than through a reinterpret_cast.  This solves segfaults when trying to use the OpenMM C-API (which is auto-generated from the generate*Wrappers.py scripts) when used with gcc/g++.  clang and clang++ seem to accept this (perhaps why it was not caught before).
Fixed segfaults caused by errors in Fortran wrapper generation
